definition: to recover one's youthful vigor/to feel rejuvenated (idiom)

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else

sentences.english: Why is robust mouse rejuvenation the quickest route to curing human aging?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼小鼠健壯返老還童是治癒人類老化的最快路線？

sentences.english: Wish the elderly rejuvenation and youth forever.
sentences.chinese: 敬祝這些長者們返老還童，永遠年輕。

sentences.english: He tried to rejuvenate himself by performing physical exercises each day.
sentences.chinese: 他試圖每天進行體育鍛煉以使自己返老還童。

sentences.english: Who satis es your desires with good things so that your youth is renewed like the eagle's.
sentences.chinese: 祂用美物使你所願的得以知足，以致你如鷹返老還童。

sentences.english: So what is going on, have the "oldsters" found the fountain of youth?
sentences.chinese: 到底怎麼回事，老兵們難道都找到了返老還童的靈泉？
現在就開始返老還童吧。

sentences.english: That time of your life has past.
sentences.chinese: 你不可能返老還童的，那段時光已經過去了。

sentences.english: ASA guidance states that the use of the term "rejuvenation" is generally unacceptable.
sentences.chinese: ASA規定一般不允許使用“返老還童”這樣的字眼。

definition: lit. to dispel the clouds and see the sun (idiom); fig. to restore justice
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
to force someone to do something
